pageContext.description: This flat oval disc of metal, somewhat buckled out of its line shape. From one point of the edge a split runs to an irregular hole in the disc. On the back (see sketch) are six claws. No. 1 is broken off short, about 1.5mm tall; 2 entirely missing, but its position is visible; 3 is like 1. Nos 4 + 6 are complete, standing 5.5mm high with their ends hammered inwards towards the centre; 5 is 4.5mm high and straight.
pageContext.surface: Smooth on outer surface, rather rougher on inner.
pageContext.associations: Part of a large hoard; see card for socketed chisel.
pageContext.publications: Evans,Arch. Journ. XXX, 279,Jessup, Arch. of Kent, 107,Journ. Anthrop. Inst. III, 230
pageContext.site: England,Kent,Saltwood,Hayne Wood, on line of railway cutting, 6 ft. below surface, lying on stratum of sand, c. 25 yards N.E. by N. of summit of hill; found June 4, 1872.
pageContext.toSearch: Saltwood, Hythe, Hythe, Kent Ct21, UK
